headline: Exclusive-Arm hires Amazon AI exec to boost plans to build its own chips
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Arm Holdings has hired Amazon.com artificial intelligence chip director Rami Sinno to bolster its plans to develop its own complete chips, a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.  Sinno was responsible for helping to develop Amazon's homegrown AI chips called Trainium and Inferentia that are designed to help build and run large AI applications.  Until now, Arm has not built its own chips.

Until now, Arm has not built its own chips.

headline: Trump administration in talks to take 10% stake in Intel, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Shares of Intel fell 3.8% on Monday, after rallying last week on hopes of U.S. federal support.  Intel has been slated to receive a combined $10.9 billion in Chips Act grants for commercial and military production, and the figure is roughly enough to pay for the government's holding, according to the Bloomberg report on Monday.  Intel and the White House did not respond to Reuters requests for comment.

raw.headline: Trump administration in talks to take 10% stake in Intel, Bloomberg News reports

Intel and the White House did not respond to Reuters requests for comment.

headline: Perplexity AI Makes $34.5 Billion Cash Bid For Google Chrome, Backed By Funds As Analyst Says Offer 'Vastly Undervalues' Asset
summary: Perplexity AI, a San Francisco-based startup backed by Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), SoftBank, and Jeff Bezos, has made an unsolicited $34.5 billion cash offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser, one of the most widely used internet tools in the world, Bloomberg reports. headline: Nvidia Stock Rises. Why Next-Gen Chip Concerns Are Overblown.
summary: Nvidia shares were up 1% to $182.24 in morning trading after falling 0.9% Friday.  Nvidia stock is likely to be range-bound ahead of its earnings report on Aug. 27.  “While the near-term bar is higher now, the 12-month picture across demand, supply, and competitive outlook all continue to be very favorable,” noted Morgan Stanley analysts led by Joseph Moore, saying supply issues are “the gating factor” for sales.

headline: Wall Street’s Strong Gains Will Be Tested Before Labor Day
summary: It has surged more than 30% from its early April lows as President Donald Trump has backed away from some of the most burdensome tariffs laid out in his so-called Liberation Day announcement.  Bets on looser monetary policy from the Federal Reserve have provided the third leg to the bull-market stool.  Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will deliver the keynote address to the central bank’s annual symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo., on Friday.

Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will deliver the keynote address to the central bank’s annual symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo., on Friday.

headline: The Interventionist-In-Chief: Heard on the Street
summary: President Trump publicly called for the resignation of the CEO of the country’s largest chip manufacturer, and then demanded a cut of revenue from two others.  Nvidia and AMD agreed to hand over 15% of the revenue they will get from selling certain AI chips into China.  Nvidia is reportedly working on a version of its latest chip family, called Blackwell, for the Chinese market.
